dmca.title: [ABUSE] COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf
Of The Planet Policy Enforcement
Posted At: Sunday, May 28, 2006 6:29 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [Fwd: [ABUSE] COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT]
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT]


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at
the address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT
Date:         Sat, 27 May 2006 19:22:03 +0100
From:         chris <chris@gregfoto.com>
To:         abuse@theplanet.com
CC:         admin@theplanet.com



To Whom It May Concern:

It has come to our attention that one of your customers, the owner of
the domain www.evagreenweb.com <http://www.evagreenweb.com/>, has
uploaded copyrighted pictures of the actress Eva Green on the set of
James Bond Casino Royale without the permission of the owner Greg
Williams. The images are located here:
http://www.evagreenweb.com/gallery/albums/albums/photoshoots/greg_willia
ms_2006_on-the-set-casino-royale/


These pictures have been stolen and are not available for publication. I
have been authorised by Mr Williams to contact you and request that
these images be removed from your server as soon as possible. The issue
is currently under investigation by Mr Williams and EON Productions and
we would appreciate your support as this has caused much professional
embarrassment. I would also like to request that the site be suspended
while we try to locate the source of these images. If you are able to
provide us with any information regarding the identity of relevant
individuals involved then please advise.

Thank-you for your cooperation.

Kind Regards,

Chris Ellis

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFEejIjvK/XpJs6oyURAmtXAJ4kH34nL/fJVKLo2nw/FwYFzMS0KQCfeFT8
blAx8VWoU4u7y6SdJ/Qtg2M=
=GcSh
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
